SEARCH
Module app
Package appv2.core.view

Class GameInitController

java.lang.Object
appv2.core.view.GameInitController
public class GameInitController extends Object

Controller for the Game Init Screen.
Handles the creation of new games and the addition of players to the game.

    • getPlayerCount

      private int getPlayerCount()

      Gets the number of players currently defined in the player name text fields.
      We can't just count the children because we also render the Player Add Button in this area as a child.

      Returns:
      The number of players currently defined.

    • getPlayerNameTextField

      private javafx.scene.control.TextField getPlayerNameTextField(int i)

      Gets the player name input field at the given index.

      Parameters:
      i - The index of the player name input field to get.
      Returns:
      The player name input field at the given index.

    • isPlayerNameTextFieldUnique

      private boolean isPlayerNameTextFieldUnique(int i)

      Checks if there are two player with the same name.

      Parameters:
      i - The index of the player name input field to check.
      Returns:
      True if the player name input field at the given index is unique, false otherwise.

    • isAPlayerNameToLong

      private boolean isAPlayerNameToLong()

      Checks if any player name given in the player name text fields is too long.

      Returns:
      True if a player name is too long, false otherwise.

    • isFormValid

      private boolean isFormValid()

      Checks if the player count and player names given are valid.

      Returns:
      True if the form is valid, false otherwise.

    • onPlayBtn

      protected void onPlayBtn()

      Starts a new game with the given player names if they are valid.
